holidays.name: Iced Tea Day
holidays.description: A day dedicated to celebrating the refreshingly cool and popular beverage that helps beat the summer heat!
holidays.origin: Iced tea has been a beloved drink in America since the early 20th century, gaining popularity after being showcased at the 1904 World's Fair in St. Louis.
holidays.funFact: Iced tea sales spike dramatically in the summer, making it one of the most consumed beverages behind water and soda!

holidays.name: Ballpoint Pen Day
holidays.description: Honoring the invention of the ballpoint pen, a writing tool that revolutionized how we jot down ideas and notes everywhere.
holidays.origin: On June 10, 1943, Hungarian inventor László Bíró patented the first commercially successful ballpoint pen.
holidays.funFact: Before the ballpoint pen, people often used fountain pens that frequently leaked or smudged, making the ballpoint pen a game changer for convenience and cleanliness.

holidays.name: Heroin Awareness Day
holidays.description: A somber awareness day dedicated to educating people about the dangers of heroin use and advocating for recovery resources.
holidays.origin: Initiated by health advocates and communities affected by opioid addiction to highlight prevention, treatment, and support.
holidays.funFact: Heroin use has tragically impacted millions, but awareness days like this help reduce stigma and promote lifesaving help.

holidays.name: Say Something Nice Day
holidays.description: A quirky day encouraging everyone to brighten someone's day by saying a kind word or compliment.
holidays.origin: An unofficial observance that encourages everyday kindness and positive communication.
holidays.funFact: Studies show that giving compliments can boost your mood as much as receiving them!
